output.name: pygbxmlcleaner
output.description: A small Python tool to clean gbXML files by removing rectangular surfaces with area below a specified tolerance.
featureList: Remove rectangular surfaces with area below the specified tolerance
Clean space boundaries referencing removed surfaces

author.name: Cyril Waechter
affiliation: CNPA - Laboratory of Numeric Cultures for Architectural Projects
author.contributionSummary: Author and maintainer of the pygbxmlcleaner tool.

hasParameter.name: file
hasParameter.description: Path to the input gbXML file to be cleaned.

hasParameter.name: output_file
hasParameter.description: Path for the output optimized XML file. If not provided, defaults to the input filename with "_optimized.xml" suffix.

hasParameter.name: tolerance
hasParameter.description: Tolerance for minimum surface area; surfaces with area less than this value will be removed.

disciplineJustification: gbXML is an XML schema for building information modeling, which is used in architectural contexts.

output.relatedToEPFLJustification:
We found multiple strong signals that the repository is related to EPFL:
1. An Infoscience entity linking the author’s laboratory (CNPA – Laboratory of Digital Culture for Architectural Projects) to EPFL (0.4).
2. The JSON-LD metadata lists “École Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne” among the repository’s related organizations (0.25).
Summing these contributions yields 0.65, exceeding the 0.5 threshold for an EPFL relationship.
